roleset.name: to represent in bodily form or incorporate
roleset.note: EMBODY-V NOTES: Frames file for 'embody' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus. Passive morphology suggests an agent role, but I can't get that reading. (from embody.01-v predicate notes)

example.name: transitive
example.text: The Bush administration plans [*-2] to announce a series of principles and to work with congressional leaders in [*-3]writing specific legislative proposals that [*T*-1] embody them .

example.name: passive
example.text: It implies that the British Empire was rooted [*-1] in its subjects ' minds , manners and morals , and argues , tacitly , that [its self-destructive flaws]-2 were embodied [*-2] in the defensive snobbery , willful blindness , role-playing and especially the locutions of its domestic servants .
example.arg: in the defensive snobbery , willful blindness , role-playing and especially the locutions of its domestic servants
